content: In the immediate term, India can hurt Pakistan by halting data-sharing, publicising new projects, optimising existing dams and escalating diplomatic pressure, thereby causing public anxiety in the already water-stressed country.

content: Chief Minister of Sikkim Prem Singh Tamang participated in a candle march held in solidarity with the victims of the terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir.

content: Elon Musk said that his brain-computer interface company Neuralink depended on robots for the brain-computer electrode insertion as the task was impossible to achieve with humans.

content: Grandpa Gang is accused of stealing Kim Kardashian's jewellery worth almost $10 million, including a $4 million diamond ring.

title: Sensex Climbs Over 1,000 Points, Crosses 80,000-Mark
content: The 30-share BSE benchmark gauge jumped over 1,000 points and crossed the 80,000-mark, while the NSE Nifty rallied more than 300 points to 24,340 as of 12:30 pm.

title: 2 Indian Nationals Charged For Robbing Woman In Singapore Hotel
content: Two Indian nationals were charged in Singapore's district court on Monday after they allegedly used pieces of clothing to tie up a woman's limbs in a hotel room and robbed her.

title: Kerala Chief Minister's Office, Residence Gets Bomb Threat, Probe On
content: Last morning, Thiruvananthapuram International Airport received a bomb threat via email, which turned out to be a hoax.

content: A woman passenger has been fined Rs 500 after visuals of her eating inside the Bengaluru metro surfaced on social media.

title: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra Asks US Industry To Invest In India
content: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra has exhorted the US industry to invest in India, stressing that the country continues to be the fastest growing major economy supported by policy consistency and certainty.

title: India, France sign Rs 63,000 crore mega deal to buy 26 Rafale Marine aircraft
content: India and France have finalized a significant deal. The agreement involves the purchase of 26 Rafale Marine aircraft for the Indian Navy. The deal is worth Rs 63,000 crore. These jets will operate from INS Vikrant. The contract includes weapons, training, and support. Deliveries are expected between 37 to 65 months. This acquisition enhances India's maritime capabilities.

title: 'Not our domain, you do something': SC to Centre on plea to ban obscenity on OTT
content: The Supreme Court has addressed a plea concerning the regulation of sexually explicit content on OTT platforms and social media, issuing a notice to the Centre. The court emphasized that implementing controls on indecent content primarily falls under the Executive and Legislature's responsibility. The government informed the court about existing regulations and contemplated additional restrictions to address the issue.

title: India's Got Latent row: Supreme Court directs return of Ranveer Allahbadia's passport
content: The Supreme Court has permitted podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia, also known as BeerBiceps, to reclaim his passport for international work travel. This decision follows the completion of investigations by Assam and Maharashtra into the "India's Got Latent" case involving him. The court is also considering consolidating the FIRs against Allahbadia into a single case.

title: Rs 1,500, a photo & a lie for Aadhaar: In UP, touts clone ‘deputy CM’
content: A fraudulent Aadhaar demographic update in Brajesh Pathak's name was rejected by UIDAI's system due to invalid documents and discrepancies. This follows an exposé on intermediaries exploiting vulnerable individuals with counterfeit documents. Consequently, an eviction notice has been issued to a café operating with a suspected Aadhaar Seva Kendra staff member, following reports of tout activity.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been ... '
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: Aunt’s call from Singapore saves girl from dad’s abuse
content: A phone call from Singapore unveiled a Chennai girl's abuse, leading to her father's arrest based on medical evidence and initial testimony. Despite the child later retracting her statements and expressing a desire for family reunification, the trial court, considering the prior evidence, sentenced the father to 20 years imprisonment and imposed a fine.

title: RR vs GT: Playing XI Prediction, pitch report, weather update
content: Gujarat Titans will aim to solidify their playoff position against Rajasthan Royals. Shubman Gill's team, powered by standout performances from Sai Sudharsan and Prasidh Krishna, faces a struggling Royals side that has lost five consecutive matches. The Jaipur pitch is expected to favour fast bowlers, with a par score around 185.

title: 'Provocative, communal content': Govt bans 16 Pakistan YouTube channels
content: The Indian government has banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels for allegedly spreading misinformation and communally sensitive content. This action follows diplomatic measures against Pakistan, including visa suspensions and the halting of the Indus Waters Treaty, in response to the Pahalgam terror attack. Pakistan has denied involvement in the attack, calling for an independent investigation.

title: How Microsoft CEO helped turn developer’s son’s illness into a free AI health tool
content: Driven by his son's rare disease diagnosis, Microsoft developer Julian Isla founded Foundation 29 to leverage AI in healthcare. Inspired by Satya Nadella's advocacy, Isla created DxGPT, a diagnostic assistant using advanced language models on Microsoft Azure. This tool analyzes symptoms, suggests diagnoses, and offers vital support to families facing complex health challenges, all while prioritizing user privacy.

title: 'Do terrorists have time for this?': Cong MLA's question on Pahalgam attack sparks row
content: Congress MLA Vijay Wadettiwar questioned the Pahalgam terror attack, doubting if terrorists verified victims' religions before killing them, urging the central government to take responsibility. This sparked controversy, with the BJP criticizing Congress for allegedly excusing Pakistan and undermining national unity. The NIA has intensified its investigation into the deadly attack, which occurred in the Baisaran meadow near Pahalgam.

title: Krunal Pandya credits former RCB skipper for his match-winning knock
content: Krunal Pandya gave credit to Virat Kohli for his match-winning innings against Delhi Capitals. He scored 73 runs off 47 balls. They had a 119-run partnership. Pandya mentioned Kohli's energy was infectious. He also said Kohli kept backing him. Pandya added that he focused on not giving up. RCB is currently at the top of the points table.

title: Bombay Shaving Co CEO on why early IIM-C reunion 'scared him to no end'
content: Shantanu Deshpande, CEO of Bombay Shaving Company, shared a LinkedIn post revealing IIM Calcutta's decision to advance its alumni reunion from 25 to 15 years. This change was prompted by the alarming fact that a growing number of alumni were not living long enough to attend the 25-year reunion.

title: J&K attack: Govt writes to BBC over its report terming 'terrorists' as 'militants'
content: The government has formally protested BBC's use of "militants" instead of "terrorists" in its coverage of the Pahalgam attack, which resulted in 26 deaths. Simultaneously, India banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels, including prominent networks like Dawn News and Geo News, for allegedly spreading misinformation and provocative content against India, its army, and security agencies following the tragic incident.

title: Why is stock market rallying today? Sensex over 1,000 points up
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in green and rallied strongly on Monday. While BSE Sensex went above 80,300, Nifty50 crossed 24,350.

title: Indus Waters Treaty: Modi govt to expedite 5 hydro power projects
content: India is accelerating five hydroelectric projects in Jammu & Kashmir after suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, aiming to boost power generation in the region by 4000MW. These projects, including Bursar, Dulhasti II, Swalkote, Uri Stage II, and Kirthai II, could be completed in 3-5 years.

title: What carved this long, winding line on Mars? NASA has the answer
content: NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter captured a stunning image of the Curiosity rover in motion, revealing its winding trail across the Martian surface. The rover, heading towards a region with potential signs of ancient groundwater activity, left tracks spanning over 1,050 feet. This marks the first mid-drive photo of Curiosity, showcasing its ongoing exploration and impact on the Red Planet.

title: Virat Kohli: 'I try and make sure my singles and doubles don't stop...'
content: Virat Kohli highlighted his focus on analysing conditions and rotating the strike after Royal Challengers Bengaluru's six-wicket victory over Delhi Capitals. Kohli (51) and Krunal Pandya (73 not out) forged a crucial 119-run partnership. Axar Patel, Delhi Capitals' skipper, felt his team fell 10-15 runs short.

title: Our son is not a topic for your entertainment: Sanjana Ganesan
content: Sanjana Ganesan expressed her dismay on Instagram regarding the online attention her son, Angad, is receiving. She and Jasprit Bumrah are working hard to protect him from social media's negative impacts. Sanjana emphasized that their presence at the cricket stadium was to support Jasprit, not to invite unwanted scrutiny and judgment towards their child, urging for more kindness online.

title: Canada elections 2025: Key candidates, major parties, issues
content: Canadians are heading to the polls in a crucial federal election, triggered by political shifts and trade tensions with the US. Prime Minister Mark Carney faces challenges from Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre and NDP's Jagmeet Singh. Key issues include affordability for younger voters and healthcare for older Canadians, as parties vie for a majority in the House of Commons.

title: Tesla refunds early India bookings: Sign of India entry soon?
content: Tesla is refunding Model 3 reservation fees to Indian customers, signaling a potential market entry amid ongoing trade negotiations between India and the US. Elon Musk plans to visit India this year.  Tesla has also secured office space in Mumbai.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: J&K assembly holds special session - Top developments
content: Following the tragic Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists, the Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly convened a special session today. India banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels, including prominent news outlets, for disseminating misinformation against the nation and its security forces.

title: Hotel worker dies from same rare rodent disease that killed Gene Hackman’s wife
content: A 26-year-old California hotel worker, also a ski enthusiast, died from Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome complications, days after Gene Hackman and his wife's passing. Betsy Arakawa, Hackman's wife, also succumbed to the same virus a week prior to her husband's death. The young man had been ill for two weeks, seeking hospital treatment before his death.

title: 'You are not just half an hour, but half a century behind': Owaisi mocks Pakistan
content: Amid escalating tensions, AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi strongly criticized Pakistan, citing ceasefire violations and rhetoric following the Pahalgam terror attack. He asserted Pakistan lags behind India, both economically and strategically.

title: Rishabh Pant defends his poor form: 'It's not the right thing to do...'
content: Rishabh Pant, the Lucknow Super Giants captain, is facing criticism for his poor batting form in the IPL, scoring only 110 runs in 10 matches with six single-digit scores. Despite being the most expensive player in IPL auction history, his performance hasn't met expectations.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack: Shoaib Akhtar's YouTube channel banned in India
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the Indian government banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels, including prominent news outlets, for allegedly spreading misinformation and inciting communal discord. Shoaib Akhtar's cricket-focused YouTube channel was also blocked amidst concerns over content regulation during sensitive times. The ban reflects efforts to curb divisive narratives, though Akhtar's content was primarily apolitical.

title: Gold price prediction: What's gold rate outlook for this week
content: Gold prices experienced significant volatility, initially soaring to record highs due to safe-haven demand amid geopolitical and economic uncertainties last week. However, prices corrected sharply following signals of potential trade negotiations and peace efforts. Investors are closely monitoring central bank independence, inflation expectations, and U.S. economic data for future policy direction.

title: Explained: How Rishabh Pant's LSG can still qualify for IPL 2025 playoffs
content: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) suffered a setback after a 54-run defeat against Mumbai Indians, impacting their playoff chances and net run rate. With five wins and five losses, LSG is currently sixth. Mentor Zaheer Khan remains confident in the team's ability to bounce back, emphasizing the need to play good cricket and avoid relying on net run rate.

title: Pahalgam attack: US calls for 'responsible solution' amid India-Pak tensions
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the United States has called on India and Pakistan to find a responsible solution. The US is closely monitoring the situation and has been in contact with both governments. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed grief over the attack, which targeted tourists. The attack, the deadliest in the Valley since the 2019 Pulwama strike, targeted mostly tourists and was claimed by The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy of the Pakistan-based terrorist organisation Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

title: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey raises concerns over 'new face of Pakistani terrorism' amid Pahalgam attack fallout
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has alleged a new form of Pakistani terrorism, claiming over five lakh Pakistani women have entered India through marriage but haven't received citizenship. This follows the government's visa restrictions on Pakistani citizens after a deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which killed 26 people.

title: 'Intentions misinterpreted': Robert Vadra clarifies remark on Pahalgam attack
content: Robert Vadra, businessman and husband of Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, has clarified his earlier remark regarding the Pahalgam terrorist attack. In a Facebook post, Vadra condemned the attack, calling it an "attack on the soul of humanity." He emphasized his solidarity with India and stated that no justification exists for violence against innocent people.

title: Tesla Cybertruck owner gets stuck in water after believing Elon Musk’s claims
content: A Tesla Cybertruck owner in California tested Elon Musk's claims about water capabilities. The owner activated 'Wade Mode' to cross water. Unfortunately, the Cybertruck got stuck, needing help from California Highway Patrol. Musk had suggested it could handle rivers, but the warranty advises caution. This incident shows the importance of understanding a vehicle's limits, despite marketing claims.

title: Pakistan violates ceasefire for fourth consecutive night, India responds
content: Pakistani troops have violated the ceasefire along the Line of Control for the fourth consecutive night, initiating unprovoked firing in the Poonch and Kupwara districts of Jammu and Kashmir, according to Indian Army officials. This escalation follows a recent terror attack in Pahalgam, where 26 Hindu tourists were killed.

title: 'This is my ground': Virat Kohli recreates Kantara scene to tease KL Rahul
content: Virat Kohli playfully mocked KL Rahul's 'this is my ground' Kantara celebration after Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Delhi Capitals. This was in response to Rahul's earlier celebration at Chinnaswamy Stadium after guiding Delhi to victory against RCB. Krunal Pandya's unbeaten 73 and Kohli's 51 helped RCB chase down the target of 162.

title: Pahalgam attack victim Shubham Dwivedi’s wife seeks martyr status for him
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the widow of Shubham Dwivedi, a 31-year-old businessman killed in the incident, is appealing to the government to grant her husband martyr status. Aishanya Dwivedi emphasized the importance of remembering victims and ensuring Shubham's sacrifice is recognized, highlighting the family's grief and desire for peace.

title: Udit Raj slams Tharoor over Pahalgam remarks: Trying to be a super-BJP man?
content: Congress leader Udit Raj criticised Shashi Tharoor's remarks on the Pahalgam terror attack, questioning his allegiance to the party and suggesting he was acting as a BJP spokesperson. Raj challenged Tharoor's comparison of the attack to the intelligence failure in Israel during the Hamas strike. He further inquired about Tharoor's knowledge of terror attacks in America post-9/11.

title: Morning news wrap: Pak violates ceasefire again, 509 Pak nationals leave India & more
content: Tensions escalate along the LoC as Pakistan violates the ceasefire for the fourth consecutive night, prompting a strong response from India. Following the Pahalgam terror attack, over 500 Pakistani nationals have exited India after visa revocations. Meanwhile, US President Trump urges Putin to pursue peace talks with Ukraine amidst ongoing conflict and missile strikes.

title: Naga Chaitanya enjoys laid-back Sunday with wife Sobhita Dhulipala and dog Hash
content: Naga Chaitanya is soaking in the weekend vibes, giving fans a sweet glimpse into his laid-back Sunday with wife Sobhita Dhulipala and their adorable pet dog, Hash. Taking to Instagram, the actor posted cozy pictures capturing moments with Hash, while Sobhita was seen relaxing beside him. Several fans pointed out that Hash was once known as the pet Naga Chaitanya shared with his ex-wife Samantha Ruth Prabhu.

title: 'Stop shooting and sign a deal': Trump to Putin after meeting Zelenskyy
content: Donald Trump has expressed his disappointment with Vladimir Putin, urging him to cease hostilities in Ukraine and finalize a peace agreement. Following a meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Trump criticized Putin's attacks on civilian areas, suggesting a potential shift in strategy towards Russia. Efforts to broker a deal continue, with the US proposing a controversial plan involving recognition of Russian-occupied territories.

title: Virat Kohli and KL Rahul exchange words during DC vs RCB match
content: During a match against Delhi Capitals, Virat Kohli was seen in a heated argument with KL Rahul, though the reason remained unclear. Kohli's fifty, along with Krunal Pandya's unbeaten 73, propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a six-wicket victory, securing their top position in the IPL table.

title: Watch: Ravi Bishnoi celebrates after smashing Jasprit Bumrah for a six
content: Ravi Bishnoi's unexpected sixes and Jasprit Bumrah's milestone weren't enough as Mumbai Indians defeated Lucknow Super Giants by 54 runs. Bumrah's impressive 4 for 22 not only secured the win but also made him the highest wicket-taker for Mumbai Indians in IPL history, surpassing Lasith Malinga. Mumbai's victory was fueled by strong batting performances from Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav.

content: the reds have clinched the 2024-25 premier league title, their first since 2020-21 and their first under new manager Arne Slot . the club have 24 wins and just two defeats in 33 matches, with four games remaining . this season, there were plenty of dramatic moments along the way to july .

title: Sources: Possible Achilles injury for Bucks' Lillard
content: Damian Lillard suffered an apparent leg injury in the first quarter . he will undergo an MRI on Monday to determine the severity of the left lower leg injury . the injury forced him to exit the game 4 loss to the Indiana Pacers . "just being honest, it's not very promising," coach says postgame .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Draft overreactions on Sanders, Cousins, Giants, Jags and Steelers
content: the 2025 draft featured an entire sub-industry of overreaction around one particular player who ended up being the 144th pick by the Browns . the discourse was on fire when the second and third rounds ended Friday night and Sanders still hadn't been drafted .

title: Lions sixth-round pick Ahmed Hassanein proposes to girlfriend after being drafted
content: Ahmed Hassanei is now the first Egyptian to be drafted into the NFL . the former boise State Broncos pass rusher proposed to his girlfriend . he was drafted by the nfl in the 2025 draft .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Takeaways from every game, including Knicks' narrow win
content: a controversial no-call on Tim Hardaway Jr.'s 3-point attempt results in the Knicks narrowly winning Game 4 over the Pistons . the Cleveland Cavaliers took a commanding 3-0 lead over the Miami Heat on Saturday without Darius Garland, handing the Heat their worst-ever playoff loss .

content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets evened the series with the No. 5 seed LA Clippers after an exciting Game 4 .

title: Dawn Among 16 Pak YouTube Channels Banned In India, BBC Gets A Warning Too
content: sixteen channels banned in india for spreading provocative and communally sensitive content . channels include news outlets Dawn, Samaa TV, ARY News, Bol News, Raftar, Geo News and Suno News . other handles that have been banned include the Pakistan Reference . the channels have been disseminating false and misleading narratives and misinformation against India .

title: "What Could I Say To Those Children...": Omar Abdullah's Pahalgam Address
content: Omar Abdullah said every part of the country came in the throes of this heinous act . he said this may mark the "beginning of the end of terror" in the valley . the BJP praised the chief minister for calling an all-party meeting .
